intro: Rosa arvensis var. stipularis, commonly known as the sticky-stemmed dog玫瑰, is a perennial shrub native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant has serrated leaves with hairy undersides, and its stems are covered in a sticky substance, which gives it its common name. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions. This species is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
